amendment.description: To require the Secretary of Homeland Security to report to the Congress in writing on the impact of the Computer Assisted Passenger Prescreening System, proposed to be implemented by the Transportation Security Administration, on the privacy and civil liberties of United States citizens.

vote.text: Amendment SA 908 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

action.text: Amendment SA 908 proposed by Senator Hollings for Senator Wyden. (consideration: CR S7802; text: CR S7802) To require the Secretary of Homeland Security to report to the Congress in writing on the impact of the Computer Assisted Passenger Prescreening System, proposed to be implemented by the Transportation Security Administration, on the privacy and civil liberties of United States citizens.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 908 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 908 proposed by Senator Hollings for Senator Wyden.
